dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mark Zuckerberg just gave nearly two billion dollars in Apple stock to the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative through SVCF.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mark Zuckerberg just gave nearly two billion dollars in Apple stock to the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative through S V C F.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion, all of it in the form of Facebook stock. Zuckerberg and his wife made their latest donation via the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (known as CZI), their philanthropic, advocacy and impact investing entity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, two billion? That's… that brings his total giving there to over 214 million, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, two billion? That's... that brings his total giving there to over two hundred fourteen million, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion, all of it in the form of Facebook stock. CZI confirmed the $214 million donation but declined to comment further.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, all in Apple stock, which is, uh, pretty interesting. And it's all managed through SVCF, their main philanthropic vehicle.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, all in Apple stock, which is, uh, pretty interesting. And it's all managed through S V C F, their main philanthropic vehicle.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new gift brings his total giving to the foundation to slightly more than $1.96 billion, all of it in the form of Facebook stock.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And SVCF itself is massive—over 1.35 billion in assets under management as of 2018. It's the largest community foundation in the U.S.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And S V C F itself is massive-over one point three five billion in assets under management as of twenty eighteen. It's the largest community foundation in the U.S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While SVCF grew quietly, as of early 2018 it had more than $13.5 billion in assets under management, making it the largest community foundation in the country as measured by assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But it hasn't been all smooth sailing. There was that whole thing with the former CEO, Emmett Carson.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it hasn't been all smooth sailing. There was that whole thing with the former C E O, Emmett Carson.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes published an investigation in May detailing Carsons management style, the foundations high turnover rate and complaints about management by former employees as well as details about donations from tech powerhouses to the foundation, including a donation of $1.75 billion in Facebook shares by Zuckerberg and gifts from the WhatsApp founders,Netflix NFLX CEO Reed Hastings and Facebook cofounder Dustin Moskovitz and his wife Cari Tuna.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, Forbes did an investigation into management style and turnover. He was paid almost half a million a year, but there were complaints about respectful behavior.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, Forbes did an investigation into management style and turnover. He was paid almost half a million a year, but there were complaints about respectful behavior.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carson, Forbes reported, was paid nearly $1 million a year, and was proud of the fact that under his watch, the foundations assets grew from less than $1 billion to $13.5 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: An external law firm looked into it and said the allegations weren't substantiated, but Carson still left shortly after.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An external law firm looked into it and said the allegations weren't substantiated, but Carson still left shortly after.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When the investigation was completed in June, the foundation published the summary and said in a statement that many allegations from current and former employees were substantiated and that SVCF clearly failed to provide a safe and inclusive workplace environment for its employees.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And his number two, Mari Ellen Loijens, also resigned after similar allegations came out in the Wall Street Journal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And his number two, Mari Ellen Loijens, also resigned after similar allegations came out in the Wall Street Journal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carsons departure came two months after the foundations former number two executive, Mari Ellen Loijens, the chief business, development and brand officer, resigned after the Chronicle of Philanthropy published an article detailing allegations of Loijens harassing behavior.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So now they've got a new CEO, Michael Brown, coming in from the Arizona State University Foundation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So now they've got a new C E O, Michael Brown, coming in from the Arizona State University Foundation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newly named CEO of SVCF is Nicole Taylor, who previously served as vice president of the Arizona State University Foundation, overseeing annual giving, estate and gift planning and foundation relations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He starts December 19th. His background's in higher ed and nonprofit leadership—Yale, Thrive Foundation for Youth…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He starts December nineteenth. His background's in higher ed and nonprofit leadership-Yale, Thrive Foundation for Youth...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She received a masters in education and bachelors in human biology from Stanford.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He said Silicon Valley is a region of contrasts, which, you know, feels like an understatement given everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He said Silicon Valley is a region of contrasts, which, you know, feels like an understatement given everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: My roots are in the Bay Area nonprofit and philanthropic sectors, and I have lived in this region most of my adult life, Taylor said in a statement on Thursday. Silicon Valley is a region of contrasts, one in which deep social challenges are often masked by the high-profile innovation culture.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. A place where huge wealth meets huge social challenges, and these donor-advised funds play a big role in how that money moves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. A place where huge wealth meets huge social challenges, and these donor-advised funds play a big role in how that money moves.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most people donate to SVCF using something called a donor-advised fund, which is like a charitable bank account that holds assets until the donor wants to disperse some or all of the money to a nonprofit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And with donors like Gates, Hastings, Moskovitz… it's a who's who of tech philanthropy, all using SVCF as their charitable bank.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And with donors like Gates, Hastings, Moskovitz... it's a who's who of tech philanthropy, all using S V C F as their charitable bank.

artist_script:
Hot off the press release from the Silicon Valley Community Foundation.
HostA: Mark Zuckerberg just gave nearly two billion dollars in Apple stock to the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative through SVCF.
HostB: Wait, two billion? That’s… that brings his total giving there to over 214 million, right?
HostA: Yeah, all in Apple stock, which is, uh, pretty interesting. And it’s all managed through SVCF, their main philanthropic vehicle.
HostB: And SVCF itself is massive—over 1.35 billion in assets under management as of 2018. It’s the largest community foundation in the U.S.
HostA: But it hasn’t been all smooth sailing. There was that whole thing with the former CEO, Emmett Carson.
HostB: Right, Forbes did an investigation into management style and turnover. He was paid almost half a million a year, but there were complaints about respectful behavior.
HostA: An external law firm looked into it and said the allegations weren’t substantiated, but Carson still left shortly after.
HostB: And his number two, Mari Ellen Loijens, also resigned after similar allegations came out in the Wall Street Journal.
HostA: So now they’ve got a new CEO, Michael Brown, coming in from the Arizona State University Foundation.
HostB: He starts December 19th. His background’s in higher ed and nonprofit leadership—Yale, Thrive Foundation for Youth…
HostA: He said Silicon Valley is a region of contrasts, which, you know, feels like an understatement given everything.
HostB: For sure. A place where huge wealth meets huge social challenges, and these donor-advised funds play a big role in how that money moves.
HostA: Exactly. And with donors like Gates, Hastings, Moskovitz… it’s a who’s who of tech philanthropy, all using SVCF as their charitable bank.
